content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Sure, here is a function in Julia that fulfills your requirements:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    lowercase(replace(strip(col), r"[ -]" => "_"))
end
```

This function takes a string `col` as input, first it strips any leading or trailing whitespaces with `strip(col)`, then it replaces any spaces and hyphens with an underscore using `replace(strip(col), r"[ -]" => "_")`, and finally it converts the cleaned string to lowercase using `lowercase()`.
